text:
Late night host James Corden has the best answer if his children ever ask him about gay relationships.

They haven’t yet because gay people have always been a part of their lives.

Corden opened up about their family life and raising his children to be accepting in an Attitude interview.

‘They haven’t brought it up, but we have lots of gay friends – like our friends Chris and Mark – who have come over a lot and stayed with us,’ he said. ‘I think my son has never questioned it as it’s always been there.’

Corden, who’s currently the host of The Late Late Show, has three children with his wife Julia Carey.

If any of his children ever ask, though, he has the perfect answer.

‘I would know what those answers were, which is that these are simply two men that really love each other in the same way I love Mummy and Grandma loves Grandad and that’s it.’

That’s a perfect answer.

Born that way

Corden added ‘no one is born wanting to dislike anyone’ and his parents raised him to be accepting. Now it’s a lesson he’s passing on to his own children.

His support of the community is nothing new.

Soon after Trump wanted to ban trans soldiers from the movie, Corden did a number supporting trans troops.

The interview describes him as an LGBT ally and he said he has an affinity with the community. However, he’s aware of his own privilege too.

‘I’ve always looked different, not the societal ideal, but I’ve never felt like an outsider to the extent that my gay friends have felt. It would be naive of me to think I have.’
title: This is how James Corden would tell his children about gay relationships
